content.description: Crux is at the third bolt. Clip from below while hands are good and make tenuous moves up and right. Finish up left on fun, easier, featured rails.
content.location: On the climbers-right side of the formation, on the face of the obvious tower. Access TR by walking up around right side of formation.

content.description:
Fun but short TR or boulder problem with a terrible landing. Good holds down low lead to a high crux involving a nice side pull but not great feet. Moves are quite fun and would be a good boulder if the landing was better.

I set this up as a solo TR using the Grickle Grass anchors but falling involved a large swing. Walking to the top is easy and it may be possible to set up a gear anchor directly above it but you'd have to extend it a bit.
content.protection: Gear anchor. Bring a lot of extension material
content.location: The system of cracks right of Deep in the Grickle Grass. This wall is at the far left of the formation and faces the highway. Walk to the top around the left side of the formation to set up a TR.

content.description: Start on easy feet and grind through the crux above the second bolt to stand in the large pocket. Lean in to an acrobatic lie back and finish on easier terrain.
content.location: Climb is located on the prominent left prow of the formation, approximately 60 ft left of Lifted and Taken Somewhere.
